data.event: The land where Salisbury is now located was first owned by Prior Bibo, a veteran of the War of 1812, in the late 1820s.

event.title: was first owned by Prior Bibo, a veteran of the War of 1812

data.event: The land where Salisbury is now located was first owned by Prior Bibo, a veteran of the War of 1812, in the late 1820s.

event.title: was sold for $400 to Judge Lucius Salisbury in 1856

data.event: Following two intermediate owners, the land was sold for $400 to Judge Lucius Salisbury in 1856.

event.title: lay out the town plat in 1857

data.event: He had surveyors lay out the town plat in 1857, and the town was founded on April 1, 1867.
He had surveyors lay out the town plat in 1857, and the town was founded on April 1, 1867.

event.title: two years later the town was struck

data.event: Just two years later the town was struck by a large tornado.

event.title: fires damaged much of the business district in 1877

data.event: Major fires damaged much of the business district in 1877 and again in 1882.

event.title: April 4, 1882, Salisbury was organized and chartered

data.event: On April 4, 1882, Salisbury was organized and chartered as a fourth-class city under Missouri laws.
